notes_text: Cannabis is classified as a class A (High-risk) drug, together with heroin, cocaine, amphetamines, and MDMA (ecstasy). Until 2004, a loosely defined "personal dose" existed.
notes: Cannabis is classified as a class A (High-risk) drug, together with heroin, cocaine, amphetamines, and MDMA (ecstasy). Until 2004, a loosely defined "personal dose" existed.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Bulgaria}} Cannabis is classified as a class A (High-risk) drug, together with [[heroin]], [[cocaine]], [[amphetamines]], and [[MDMA]] (ecstasy). Until 2004, a loosely defined "personal dose" existed.<ref>{{cite web |title=Bulgaria: Country Drug Report 2017 |url=http://www.emcdda.europa.eu/countries/drug-reports/2017/bulgaria/drug-laws-and-offences_en |publisher=European Monitoring Centre for Drugs and Drug Addiction |access-date=17 October 2018 |archive-date=17 October 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181017123705/http://www.emcdda.europa.eu/countries/drug-reports/2017/bulgaria/drug-laws-and-offences_en |url-status=live }}</ref>
